column2: The contribution of the sectors covered by the EU ETS with respect to the EU Climate ambition should be of -62% compared to 2005
column5: The reduction of fuel intensity in the EU fisheries sector will likely have a positive impact on the EU's overall greenhouse gas emissions reduction targets, as the fisheries sector is a significant contributor to emissions.

column2: The contribution of the sectors covered by the EU ETS with respect to the EU Climate ambition should be of -62% compared to 2005
column5: The increase in the use of zero-emission vehicles in the EU's urban bus fleet will likely have a positive impact on the EU's overall greenhouse gas emissions reduction targets, as the transport sector is a significant contributor to emissions.

column2: The decline of pollinators is reversed
column5: The decline of pollinators is likely to have a negative impact on the EU's biodiversity targets, as pollinators play a crucial role in maintaining ecosystem health.

column2: The risk and use of chemical pesticides is reduced by 50%, and the use of more hazardous pesticides is reduced by 50%
column5: The reduction of chemical pesticides will likely have a negative impact on the EU's targets for reducing waste, as the disposal of pesticides can contribute to waste generation.

column2: The obligation to set up urban wastewater collecting systems is extended to all agglomerations with a p.e. of 1,000 or more and all source of urban wastewater should be connected to them
column5: The extension of urban wastewater collecting systems will likely have a positive impact on the EU's targets for reducing waste, as it will improve waste management and reduce pollution.

column2: Improve soil quality by reducing nutrient losses and chemical pesticides’ use by 50% (target partially in common with the Farm to Fork strategy and Biodiversity strategy)
column5: The improvement of soil quality will likely have a positive impact on the reduction of chemical pesticides, as healthier soils require fewer pesticides.

column2: Improve soil quality by reducing nutrient losses and chemical pesticides’ use by 50% (target partially in common with the Farm to Fork strategy and Biodiversity strategy)
column5: The improvement of soil quality will likely have a negative impact on the EU's targets for reducing waste, as the use of fertilizers and pesticides can contribute to waste generation.

column2: Develop measures to significantly increase efforts to identify, investigate, assess and remediate contaminated sites, so that soil pollution will no longer pose a health or environmental risk
column5: The remediation of contaminated sites will likely have a positive impact on the EU's targets for reducing waste, as it will improve waste management and reduce pollution.

column2: Improve air quality to reduce the number of premature deaths caused by air pollution by 55%
column5: The improvement of air quality will likely have a positive impact on the EU's targets for reducing greenhouse gas emissions, as air pollution is a significant contributor to emissions.

column2: Improve water quality by reducing waste, plastic litter at sea (by 50%) and microplastics released into the environment (by 30%)
column5: The improvement of water quality will likely have a positive impact on the EU's targets for reducing waste, as it will improve waste management and reduce pollution.

column2: Improve water quality by reducing waste, plastic litter at sea (by 50%) and microplastics released into the environment (by 30%)
column5: The improvement of water quality will likely have a positive impact on the EU's targets for reducing waste, as it will improve waste management and reduce pollution.

column2: Reduce by 25% the EU ecosystems where air pollution threatens biodiversity
column5: The reduction of air pollution will likely have a positive impact on the EU's biodiversity targets, as air pollution is a significant threat to ecosystem health.

column2: Reduce significantly total waste generation and by 50% residual municipal waste
column5: The reduction of waste generation will likely have a positive impact on the EU's targets for reducing waste, as it will improve waste management and reduce pollution.

column2: Reduce significantly total waste generation and by 50% residual municipal waste
column5: The reduction of waste generation will likely have a positive impact on the EU's targets for reducing waste, as it will improve waste management and reduce pollution.

column2: Improve soil quality by reducing nutrient losses and chemical pesticides’ use by 50% (target partially in common with the Farm to Fork strategy and Biodiversity strategy)
column5: The improvement of soil quality will likely have a positive impact on the reduction of chemical pesticides, as healthier soils require fewer pesticides.

column2: Having all soils in healthy condition by 2050
column5: The improvement of soil health will likely have a positive impact on the reduction of chemical pesticides, as healthier soils require fewer pesticides.

column2: Minimise or eliminate the use of pesticides in sensitive areas such as urban green areas
column5: The reduction of pesticide use in urban areas will likely have a positive impact on the reduction of chemical pesticides, as it will reduce the overall use of pesticides.

column2: The revision of the Ambient Air Quality Directives would merge the Directives into one, and seek to align EU air quality standards more closely with WHO recommendations
column5: The revision of the Ambient Air Quality Directives will likely have a positive impact on the EU's targets for reducing greenhouse gas emissions, as air pollution is a significant contributor to emissions.

column2: Remove micropollutants from wastewater
column5: The removal of micropollutants from wastewater will likely have a positive impact on the EU's targets for reducing waste, as it will improve waste management and reduce pollution.

column2: Improve nutrient removal from wastewater
column5: The improvement of nutrient removal from wastewater will likely have a positive impact on the EU's targets for reducing waste, as it will improve waste management and reduce pollution.

column2: nan
column5: The extension of urban wastewater collecting systems will likely have a negative impact on the EU's targets for reducing waste, as the construction of new infrastructure can generate waste.

column2: From 2025, beverage bottles listed in Part F of the Annex which are manufactured from polyethylene terephthalate as the major component (‘PET bottles’) contain at least 25% recycled plastic
column5: The increase in the use of recycled plastic in beverage bottles will likely have a positive impact on the EU's targets for reducing waste, as it will improve waste management and reduce pollution.

column2: Member States shall meet the target of 77% by weight for the separate collection for recycling of waste single-use plastic beverage bottles by 2025 and 90% by 2029
column5: The increase in the separate collection for recycling of waste single-use plastic beverage bottles will likely have a positive impact on the EU's targets for reducing waste, as it will improve waste management and reduce pollution.

column2: From 2019, the minimum collection rate to be achieved annually shall be 65% of the average weight of EEE placed on the market in the three preceding years in the Member State concerned, or alternatively 85% of WEEE generated on the territory of that Member State.
column5: The increase in the collection rate of WEEE will likely have a negative impact on the EU's targets for reducing waste, as the collection and processing of WEEE can generate waste.

column2: From 15 August 2018, the recovery targets for the WEEE falling within the following categories of Annex III shall be: - 85% for Category 1 (temperature exchange equipment) or Category 4 (large equipment with any external dimension more than 50 cm)
column5: The increase in the recovery targets for WEEE will likely have a negative impact on the EU's targets for reducing waste, as the collection and processing of WEEE can generate waste.

column2: From 15 August 2018, the preparation for re-use targets for the WEEE falling within the following categories of Annex III shall be: - 80% for Category 1 or Category 4
column5: The increase in the preparation for re-use targets for WEEE will likely have a negative impact on the EU's targets for reducing waste, as the collection and processing of WEEE can generate waste.

column2: From 15 August 2018, the recycling targets for the WEEE falling within the following categories of Annex III shall be: - 0% for Category 1 or Category 4
column5: The increase in the recycling targets for WEEE will likely have a negative impact on the EU's targets for reducing waste, as the collection and processing of WEEE can generate waste.

column2: By 2025, the preparing for re-use and recycling of municipal waste shall be increased to a minimum of 55% by weight
column5: The increase in the preparing for re-use and recycling of municipal waste will likely have a positive impact on the EU's targets for reducing waste, as it will improve waste management and reduce pollution.

column2: Member States should aim to achieve an indicative Union-wide food waste reduction target of 30% by 2025 and 50% by 2030
column5: The reduction of food waste will likely have a positive impact on the EU's targets for reducing waste, as it will improve waste management and reduce pollution.

column2: Hazardous household waste will have to be collected separately by 2022, bio-waste by 2023 and textiles by 2025
column5: The separate collection of hazardous household waste, bio-waste, and textiles will likely have a positive impact on the EU's targets for reducing waste, as it will improve waste management and reduce pollution.

column5: The extension of urban wastewater collecting systems will likely have a negative impact on the EU's targets for reducing waste, as the construction of new infrastructure can generate waste.

column2: By 2030 producers will have responsibility for their products along the value chain, including when they become waste
column5: The extension of producer responsibility will likely have a positive impact on the EU's targets for reducing waste, as it will improve waste management and reduce pollution.

column2: Union's access to a secure and sustainable supply of critical raw materials by ensuring that the Union's extraction capacity is able to extract the ores, minerals or concentrates needed to produce at least 10% of the Union's annual consumption of strategic raw materials
column5: The increase in the extraction capacity of critical raw materials will likely have a positive impact on the EU's targets for improving soil quality, as it will reduce the need for imported raw materials and minimize the environmental impacts associated with extraction.

column2: Union's access to a secure and sustainable supply of critical raw materials by ensuring that the Union's processing capacity, including for all intermediate processing steps, is able to produce at least 40% of the Union's annual consumption of strategic raw materials
column5: The increase in the processing capacity of critical raw materials will likely have a positive impact on the EU's targets for improving soil quality, as it will reduce the need for imported raw materials and minimize the environmental impacts associated with processing.

column2: *The amendments in Dir. 2023/2413 are also intended to support the achievement of the Union’s target of an annual production of sustainable biomethane of 35 billion cubic meters by 2030
column5: The increase in the production of sustainable biomethane will likely have a positive impact on the EU's targets for reducing greenhouse gas emissions, as biomethane can replace fossil fuels and reduce emissions.

column2: EU fisheries are encouraged to continue the positive trend, as observed for the period 2009-2019, towards reducing fuel intensity by reducing the fossil-fuel consumption per kg of landed product for at least an additional 15% for the period 2019-2030
column5: The reduction of fuel intensity in the EU fisheries sector will likely have a positive impact on the EU's overall greenhouse gas emissions reduction targets, as the fisheries sector is a significant contributor to emissions.

column2: Reduce the average door-to-door cost of combined transport operations by at least 10% within 7 years
column5: The reduction of transport costs will likely have a positive impact on the EU's targets for reducing greenhouse gas emissions, as it will encourage the use of more efficient and environmentally friendly transport modes.

column2: GHG intensity reduction target in the maritime sector
column5: The reduction of greenhouse gas emissions in the maritime sector will likely have a positive impact on the EU's overall greenhouse gas emissions reduction targets, as the maritime sector is a significant contributor to emissions.

column2: For new urban buses the share of zeroemissions vehicles shall be 100% as from the reporting period of the year 2030
column5: The increase in the use of zero-emission vehicles in the EU's urban bus fleet will likely have a positive impact on the EU's overall greenhouse gas emissions reduction targets, as the transport sector is a significant contributor to emissions.

column2: Renewable and low-carbon fuels should represent between 6% and 9% of the international maritime transport fuel mix by 2030 and between 86% and 88% by 2050
column5: The increase in the use of renewable and low-carbon fuels in the maritime sector will likely have a positive impact on the EU's overall greenhouse gas emissions reduction targets, as it will reduce emissions from the maritime sector.

column2: The average CO2 emissions of the Union fleet of new heavy-duty motor vehicles, other than special purpose, off-road, off-road special purpose, and vocational vehicles shall be reduced by the following percentages compared to the average CO2 emissions of the reporting period of the year 2019
column5: The reduction of CO2 emissions from heavy-duty vehicles will likely have a positive impact on the EU's overall greenhouse gas emissions reduction targets, as the transport sector is a significant contributor to emissions.

column2: From 1 January 2020, this Regulation sets an EU fleet-wide target of 95 g CO2/km for the average emissions of new passenger cars and an EU fleet-wide target of 147 g CO2/km for the average emissions of new light commercial vehicles registered in the Union, as measured until 31 December 2020 in accordance with Regulation (EC) No 692/2008 together with Implementing Regulations (EU) 2017/1152 and (EU) 2017/1153, and from 1 January 2021 measured in accordance with Regulation (EU) 2017/1151.
column5: The reduction of CO2 emissions from passenger cars and light commercial vehicles will likely have a positive impact on the EU's overall greenhouse gas emissions reduction targets, as the transport sector is a significant contributor to emissions.

column2: This Regulation will, until 31 December 2024, be complemented by additional measures corresponding to a reduction of 10 g CO2/km as part of the Union's integrated approach referred to in the Commission's communication of 7 February 2007 entitled ‘Results of the review of the Community Strategy to reduce CO2 emissions from passenger cars and light-commercial vehicles
column5: The reduction of CO2 emissions from passenger cars and light commercial vehicles will likely have a positive impact on the EU's overall greenhouse gas emissions reduction targets, as the transport sector is a significant contributor to emissions.
